meanings.definition: Distill (a liquid) again to increase its purity or strength.
meanings.sent1: The chemist redistilled the water to make it cleaner.
meanings.sent2: She redistilled the perfume to make it more concentrated.
meanings.sent3: The wizard redistilled the potion, hoping for a stronger effect.
meanings.sent4: The idea was redistilled in his mind until it became crystal clear.
meanings.sent5: The process of redistilling the essence brought out its true nature.

meanings.definition: Subject (a liquid) to a process of distillation again.
meanings.sent1: He decided to redistill the alcohol for a purer result.
meanings.sent2: The distiller redistilled the whiskey for a smoother taste.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally redistilled the soup, creating a new recipe.
meanings.sent4: The knowledge was redistilled through generations of storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The essence of the story was redistilled in the final chapter.
